alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Lauderdale (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:57AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jasper, Clarke and southeastern Lauderdale Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 356 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Barnett, or 9 miles southwest of Quitman, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Quitman and De Soto around 405 AM CDT. Stonewall around 410 AM CDT. Sykes and Sable around 415 AM CDT. Middleton around 420 AM CDT. Snell and Increase around 425 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Pachuta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for east central Mississippi.
